DavidM_Peele_

Summary
Nitrosation of naturally occurririg tobacco alkaloids is commonly accepted as ine
mechanism of tobacco specific nitrosamine (TSNA) fcmation in tobacco.
As
minimal-to-no TSNA are present in green tobacco,
TSNA formation and
accumulation are generally considered to occur curing curing:
Most recent
hypotheses
0n microbial reduction of nitrate t0 nitrite and other oxides of
nitrogen (NO, compounds) that reaci wvith tobacco alkaloids to form TSNA during
curing:
This nztural microbia
process remains the prevalent hypothesis for
TSNA formation in cured burley tobacco.
However_
a second mechanism for the
formation of TSNA, independent of microbial activity, is presented in this vork Cn
flue-cured tobacco.
It is common practice to flue-cure Virginia or blonde tobacco in bulk bams tnat
incorporate forced air ventilation and temperature control:
Modern bulk barns
generally use liquid prcpane gas (LPG) with direct-fired burners thai exhaust
combustion gases clirectly into
barn where tne tcbacco is exposed t0 those
corbustion gases_
Our studies indicalte that LPG combustion by-products
namely NOx (in tne exnaust stream ot direct-fired; tlue-cured barns) react with
naturally 0
ccurring tobacco alkaloids to forr TSNA
Heat exchange curirig
methods preclude expcsure of the
tobaccc to combustion gases and by-
producte, thereby eliminating this significant source of TSNA tormation, without
degrading leaf quality or smoking character _
Research findings irom 1998 and
839 will be presented to demonstrate the significance of direct-fired
as 4
source of TSNA fommation in fluc-cured tobacco_
Introduction
For decades, nitrosamiries have been a foCus 0f considerable research for
vhence reterences abound in the scientific literature_
The presence of
nilrosamines in cigarette smoke and their possible role In tcbacco
carcinogenesis were
postulated in the scientific literature in
1962.
Extensive research by many investigators since the 1270'$ repcred
presence Of as miary &s thirty-five (35_
nitrosarnines in cigarelte smoke_
sibset of tinose nitrosamines was considercd to be specific to tobacco, resulting
